facilities.title: Attractions Near Kudajadri Drizzle Homestay Wayanad
facilities.subtitle: Experience
facilities.subParagraph: Kudajadri Drizzle Homestay in Wayanad is ideally located, equidistant from Bathery, Mananthavady, Kalpetta, and Meppadi, making it a perfect base to explore the region. Guests can easily visit stunning waterfalls, serene lakes, and lush spice plantations nearby. Wildlife sanctuaries, trekking trails, and ancient temples are also within reach, offering a mix of adventure, culture, and nature. With panoramic viewpoints and scenic landscapes just a short drive away, staying at Kudajadri Drizzle ensures convenient access to Wayanad’s top attractions for an unforgettable and well-rounded travel experience.

cards.title: Chembra Peak Wayanad
cards.description: Chembra Peak is the highest peak in Wayanad, at 2,050 m above sea level. With a height of 2,100 m (6,890 ft), the summit offers breathtaking views of the entire Wayanad region.

cards.title: Kuruva Island Wayanad
cards.description: Kuruva Island, spread across 950 acres of evergreen forest on the Kabani River, is an ideal picnic spot away from city life. This uninhabited island is perfect for peace and nature lovers.

cards.title: Edakkal Caves Wayanad
cards.description: Edakkal Caves, located 1,200 m above sea level on Ambukutty Hill, are the only known place in India with Stone Age carvings. These ancient cave paintings date back to 6000 BC.

cards.title: Pookkode Lake Wayanad
cards.description: Pookkode Lake is a natural freshwater lake in Lakkidi, surrounded by evergreen forests and the Western Ghats. Its pristine beauty and unspoiled charm make it a must-visit destination.
